Gets a value indicating that remote WebImage load is allowed.
Gets a value indicating if I-Load has to use the WebCoreModule HttpHandler.
Gets a value indicating if I-Load is in Debug mode.
summary.remarks: The debug mode is useful to solve some types of issues. For example, when there is an error inside the class that implements the interface. The debug mode is disabled by default.

summary.para: Gets a value indicating how I-Load persists temporary objects.
summary.remarks: The default I-Load settings are: - If the application SessionStateMode is set to StateServer or SQLServer, then I-Load will use Session State to store temporary objects (). - In all other cases (InProc, Off, etc...), I-Load will store temporary objects as temporary files () inside the default temporary folder (). If you are using a multi-worker process environment (such as Microsoft IIS Web Gardens or multiple Servers within a Web Farm), and you want to set to then the default temporary folder () must be common and accessible by all processes.

summary.para: Gets the file extensions blocked by I-Load.
Gets a value indicating if I-Load allows to invoke the WebCoreModule.ashx to check if the HttpHandler and the HttpModule are correctly installed.
summary.remarks: After the deployment, set this property to false to increase the security (the default value is true).

Encapsulates the I-Load web control temporary file manager settings.
Gets a value indicating if the temporary files will be automatically deleted.
Gets a value indicating if I-Load has to detect session end, and, automatically delete temporary resources associated with ended sessions.
Gets a value indicating the max time (expressed in minutes) before temporary files are deleted.
Gets the default folder path used by I-Load to store temporary files.
summary.remarks: When is set to then temporary objects files are persisted in this folder. If you are using a multi-worker process environment (such as Microsoft IIS Web Gardens or multiple Servers within a Web Farm) then the default temporary folder must be common and accessible by all processes.

summary.para: Specifies how I-Load temporary objects are stored.
Default value.
- If the application SessionStateMode is set to StateServer or SQLServer, then I-Load will use Session State to store temporary objects ().
- In all other cases (InProc, Off, etc...), I-Load will store temporary objects as temporary files () inside the default temporary folder ().
Temporary objects are stored in the session state.
(Suggested choice) Temporary objects are store as temporary files inside the default temporary folder ().

Force I-Load to use the "XHTML 1.1" standard.

member.name: M:Radactive.WebControls.ILoad.Core.Drawing.CustomImageProcessor.GetImageFormatMimeType(System.Drawing.Imaging.ImageFormat)

summary.para: Gets the mime type for an .

member.returns: The mime type for the image format. If the result is an empty string, then I-Load will use the default internal function to generate the mime type.

summary.para: Specifies the image resize generation mode.
The image resize is a zoom resize, and size is calculated applying a zoom factor to the original image size.
For example, if original image size is 300x200 pixel, and the zoom factor is 200%, then the image resize size will be 600x400 pixel.
This is the best choice when you must create enlarged image views to display in popup windows.
The image resize size is calculate to stay into a certain frame size taking into consideration original image aspect ratio.
This is the best choice when you must create image resizes to display in detailed web pages.
The image resize size is fixed, without taking into consideration original image aspect ratio.
Using this option, the image resize generated will be always of a certain size.
If the resize fixed size aspect ratio is not equal to the original image size, there are two options: crop a portion of source image, or fill the final resize image with a backgrond color.
This is the best choice when you must create icon image resizes to display in preview web pages or in record list web pages.
Specifies an image dimension.
Specifies the image width.
Specifies the image height.
This class is intended for internal use only.

summary.para: Exception generated by I-Load control if unsupported session state mode is detected.
This class is intended for internal use only.
This class is intended for internal use only.
Interface to implement when you use a custom storage (eg: a database) to store I-Load file.
To configure I-Load to use your Custom Storage Manager edit the Web.Config file: radactive.iload / settings / customStorageManager / type.
Example: If you plan to store I-Load images into a database, then you have to write a custom implementation of ICustomStorageManager.
This class is required in order to load-save I-Load files from-to a database.

member.returns: True if the index xml file exists, otherwise false.

HttpModule used by I-Load to perform image upload process.

remarks.para: In order to work, I-Load control requires installed in the web.config file of web application.
I-Load control ensures that is installed performing checks both during design time inside Microsoft Visual Studio.NET, and during runtime when I-Load control is rendered.
If during design time inside Microsoft Visual Studio.NET, I-Load detects that is not installed, a a popup window is displayed to ask for automatic insertion inside web.config file as HttpModule.

member.name: M:Radactive.WebControls.ILoad.Core.WebCoreModule.Init(System.Web.HttpApplication)

summary.para: Initializes a module and prepares it to handle requests.

member.param: An HttpApplication that provides access to the methods, properties, and events common to all application objects within an ASP.NET application.

summary.para: Dispose performs any final cleanup work prior to removal of the module from the execution pipeline.
This class is intended for internal use only.
This class is intended for internal use only.
